messages.title: LIVERPOOL L15
messages.content: In the next few days you will receive your ballot papers for the general election and the local election – you have a choice. I’m writing to you to ask you to think carefully about what’s at stake for both the country and Liverpool.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promises of no government can please everybody all the time but the changes we have made to our health service and schools are there for all to see.

We have given financial help to families and businesses through the tax credits, childcare, minimum wage, winter fuel allowance and free pensioner bus pass. Deficit reduction is the reason we have intervened to make sure we didn't see the long dole queues that Liverpool saw under the Tories.
We can't trust the Tories with our schools and hospitals and neither can we trust them with tax credits and help for our elderly.
Locally we need to see a council with vision, one that is prepared to tackle city housing problems, dirty streets, antisocial behaviour and bring jobs for local people into the city.

housing.content: Locally we need to see a council with vision, one that is prepared to tackle city housing problems, dirty streets, antisocial behaviour and bring jobs for local people into the city.

images.caption: How to complete your postal vote instructions

leaflet.additionalNotes: p.s. please use both your votes for Labour. Don't let the Tories wreck our city again.
